001package org.krmdemo.techlabs.json;
002
003import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonIgnoreProperties;
004import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonInclude;
005import com.fasterxml.jackson.annotation.JsonInclude.Include;
006import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.JsonProcessingException;
007import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.PrettyPrinter;
008import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.type.TypeReference;
009import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.util.DefaultIndenter;
010import com.fasterxml.jackson.core.util.DefaultPrettyPrinter;
011import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.JsonNode;
012import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.ObjectMapper;
013import com.fasterxml.jackson.databind.SerializationFeature;
014import com.fasterxml.jackson.datatype.jsr310.JavaTimeModule;
015import lombok.Getter;
016import lombok.NonNull;
017import lombok.ToString;
018import lombok.extern.slf4j.Slf4j;
019import org.apache.commons.lang3.exception.ExceptionUtils;
020
021import java.io.File;
022import java.io.FileInputStream;
023import java.io.IOException;
024import java.io.InputStream;
025import java.util.List;
026import java.util.Map;
027
028import static org.apache.commons.lang3.StringUtils.isBlank;
029
030/**
031 * Utility class to serialize / de-serialize JSON-Objects and JSON-Arrays
032 * using <a href="https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson">Jackson Library</a>
033 *
034 * @see <a href="https://github.com/FasterXML/jackson-docs">
035 *     Jackson Library Documentation
036 * </a>
037 */
038@Slf4j
039public class JacksonUtils {
040
041    @Getter
042    @ToString
043    @JsonInclude(Include.NON_EMPTY)
044    @JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
045    public static class AnyError {
046        private final String exceptionClass;
047        private final String message;
048        private final List<String> stackTrace;
049        public AnyError(@NonNull Exception ex) {
050            this.exceptionClass = ex.getClass().getName();
051            this.message = ex.getMessage();
052            this.stackTrace = ExceptionUtils.getRootCauseStackTraceList(ex);
053        }
054    }
055
056    @Getter @ToString
057    @JsonInclude(Include.NON_EMPTY)
058    @JsonIgnoreProperties(ignoreUnknown = true)
059    public static class JsonError extends AnyError {
060        private final String originalMessage;
061        private final String location;
062        public JsonError(JsonProcessingException jsonEx) {
063            super(jsonEx);
064            this.originalMessage = jsonEx.getOriginalMessage();
065            this.location = jsonEx.getLocation() == null ? "" : jsonEx.getLocation().toString();
066        }
067    }
068
069    public static AnyError errorFrom(Exception ex) { return new AnyError(ex); }
070    public static JsonError errorFrom(JsonProcessingException jsonEx) { return new JsonError(jsonEx); }
071
072    private static final ObjectMapper OBJECT_MAPPER_DUMP =
073        new ObjectMapper()
074            .registerModule(new JavaTimeModule())
075            .enable(SerializationFeature.INDENT_OUTPUT);
076
077    public static JsonNode jsonTreeFromString(String jsonContent) {
078        try {
079            return OBJECT_MAPPER_DUMP.readTree(jsonContent);
080        } catch (JsonProcessingException jsonEx) {
081            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
082                String.format("could not read the JSON-Tree:%n---%n'%s'%n---%n", jsonContent), jsonEx);
083        }
084    }
085
086    public static <T> T jsonValueFromString(String jsonContent, TypeReference<T> typeRef) {
087        try {
088            return OBJECT_MAPPER_DUMP.readValue(jsonContent, typeRef);
089        } catch (JsonProcessingException jsonEx) {
090            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
091                String.format("could not read <%s>:%n---%n'%s'%n---%n", typeRef, jsonContent), jsonEx);
092        }
093    }
094
095    public static Map<String, Object> jsonObjFromString(String jsonContent) {
096        // automatic casting to "java.util.Map" looks like a magic
097        return jsonValueFromString(jsonContent, new TypeReference<>(){});
098    }
099
100    public static List<Object> jsonArrFromString(String jsonContent) {
101        // automatic casting to "java.util.List" looks like a magic
102        return jsonValueFromString(jsonContent, new TypeReference<>(){});
103    }
104
105    public static JsonNode jsonTreeFromResource(String resourcePath) {
106        ClassLoader classLoader = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
107        try (InputStream resourceStream = classLoader.getResourceAsStream(resourcePath)) {
108            return OBJECT_MAPPER_DUMP.readTree(resourceStream);
109        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
110            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
111                String.format("could not load the JSON-Tree from JSON-resource by path '%s'", resourcePath), ioEx);
112        }
113    }
114
115    public static <T> T jsonValueFromResource(String resourcePath, TypeReference<T> typeRef) {
116        ClassLoader classLoader = Thread.currentThread().getContextClassLoader();
117        try (InputStream resourceStream = classLoader.getResourceAsStream(resourcePath)) {
118            return OBJECT_MAPPER_DUMP.readValue(resourceStream, typeRef);
119        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
120            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
121                String.format("could not load <%s> from resource by path '%s'", typeRef, resourcePath), ioEx);
122        }
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * @param resourcePath the path to JSON-resource within the current class-path (no leading slash !!!)
127     * @return de-serialized JSON-Object as {@link Map}
128     */
129    public static Map<String, Object> jsonObjFromResource(String resourcePath) {
130        // automatic casting to "java.util.Map" looks like a magic
131        return jsonValueFromResource(resourcePath, new TypeReference<>(){});
132    }
133
134    /**
135     * @param resourcePath the path to JSON-resource within the current class-path (no leading slash !!!)
136     * @return de-serialized JSON-Object as {@link List}
137     */
138    public static List<Object> jsonArrFromResource(String resourcePath) {
139        // automatic casting to "java.util.List" looks like a magic
140        return jsonValueFromResource(resourcePath, new TypeReference<>(){});
141    }
142
143    /**
144     * @param jsonFile a file that contains JSON-value
145     * @return the root node of de-serialized JSON-Tree
146     */
147    public static JsonNode jsonTreeFromFile(File jsonFile) {
148        try (FileInputStream resourceStream = new FileInputStream(jsonFile)) {
149            return OBJECT_MAPPER_DUMP.readTree(resourceStream);
150        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
151            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
152                String.format("could not load the JSON-Tree from JSON-file '%s'", jsonFile), ioEx);
153        }
154    }
155
156    /**
157     * @param jsonFile a file that contains JSON-value
158     * @param typeRef a type-reference to cast the de-serialized object to
159     * @return de-serialized JSON-vlaue of type <code>T</code>
160     * @param <T> the type to de-serialize the JSON-value to
161     */
162    public static <T> T jsonValueFromFile(File jsonFile, TypeReference<T> typeRef) {
163        try (FileInputStream resourceStream = new FileInputStream(jsonFile)) {
164            return OBJECT_MAPPER_DUMP.readValue(resourceStream, typeRef);
165        } catch (IOException ioEx) {
166            throw new IllegalArgumentException(
167                String.format("could not load <%s> from JSON-file '%s'", typeRef, jsonFile), ioEx);
168        }
169    }
170
171    /**
172     * @param jsonFile a file that contains JSON-Object
173     * @return de-serialized JSON-Object as {@link Map}
174     */
175    public static Map<String, Object> jsonObjFromFile(File jsonFile) {
176        // automatic casting to "java.util.Map" looks like a magic
177        return jsonValueFromFile(jsonFile, new TypeReference<>(){});
178    }
179
180    /**
181     * @param jsonFile a file that contains JSON-Array
182     * @return de-serialized JSON-Object as {@link List}
183     */
184    public static List<Object> jsonArrFromFile(File jsonFile) {
185        // automatic casting to "java.util.List" looks like a magic
186        return jsonValueFromFile(jsonFile, new TypeReference<>(){});
187    }
188
189    /**
190     * @param value the object to dump
191     * @return serialized object in JSON-format (the default, NOT pretty-print)
192     */
193    public static String dumpAsJson(Object value) {
194        try {
195            return OBJECT_MAPPER_DUMP.writeValueAsString(value);
196        } catch (JsonProcessingException jsonEx) {
197            log.error("could not dump the value as JSON", jsonEx);
198            return dumpAsJson(errorFrom(jsonEx));
199        }
200    }
201
202    private static final PrettyPrinter PRETTY_PRINTER = prettyPrinter();
203    private static DefaultPrettyPrinter prettyPrinter() {
204        DefaultPrettyPrinter defaultPrettyPrinter = new DefaultPrettyPrinter();
205        defaultPrettyPrinter.indentArraysWith(DefaultIndenter.SYSTEM_LINEFEED_INSTANCE); // <-- 2 spaces
206        return defaultPrettyPrinter;
207    }
208
209    private static final ObjectMapper OBJECT_MAPPER_PRETTY_PRINT = objectMapperPrettyPrint();
210    private static ObjectMapper objectMapperPrettyPrint() {
211        ObjectMapper objectMapper = new ObjectMapper()
212            .registerModule(new JavaTimeModule())
213            .enable(SerializationFeature.INDENT_OUTPUT)
214            .enable(SerializationFeature.ORDER_MAP_ENTRIES_BY_KEYS);
215        objectMapper.configOverride(Map.class).setInclude(
216            JsonInclude.Value.construct(Include.NON_EMPTY, Include.NON_EMPTY));
217        return objectMapper;
218    }
219
220    /**
221     * @param value the object to dump in a pretty-print way
222     * @return serialized object in JSON-format (pretty-print - the keys are sorted and arrays are indented)
223     */
224    public static String dumpAsJsonPrettyPrint(Object value) {
225        try {
226            return OBJECT_MAPPER_PRETTY_PRINT.writer(PRETTY_PRINTER).writeValueAsString(value);
227        } catch (JsonProcessingException jsonEx) {
228            log.error("could not dump the value as pretty-print JSON", jsonEx);
229            return dumpAsJson(errorFrom(jsonEx));
230        }
231    }
232
233    /**
234     * Prettify the passed un-formatted JSON
235     *
236     * @param jsonToPrettify JSON to prettify
237     * @return properly formatted JSON (with indentation of 2 spaces)
238     */
239    public static String prettifyJson(String jsonToPrettify) {
240        if (isBlank(jsonToPrettify)) {
241            log.warn("attempt to pretty-print the blank string - return the empty string");
242            return "";
243        }
244        JsonNode jsonTree = jsonTreeFromString(jsonToPrettify);
245        return dumpAsJsonPrettyPrint(jsonTree);
246    }
247
248    private JacksonUtils() {
249        // prohibit the creation of utility-class instance
250        throw new UnsupportedOperationException("Cannot instantiate utility-class " + getClass().getName());
251    }
252}
